assessments.task_description:
Goal:

This assessment challenges you to showcase your comprehension of crucial human capital development principles and frameworks. You will demonstrate this by analysing a real-world case study, crafting a solution or recommendation, and presenting your findings with clarity and impact in a concise Executive Summary. NOTE: Your work should focus on demonstrating your critical thinking and problem-solving skills rather than simply summarising the case study.

Task description:

You are required to work in teams to prepare Executive Summaries based on the case studies related to human capital development within an organization. For each seminar, students must read the relevant case study aligned with the seminar topic. All case studies are available in the Learning Resources section on Blackboard.

In this course, you will be placed into a group for the semester. As a formative learning exercise in weeks 5, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11and 12, your group can choose to prepare a brief executive summary (600-750 words) relating to the case study. This assessment requires you to only submit five (5) executive summaries for marking over the semester. Whether you choose to prepare an executive summary each week is up to your group to decide. Completing more summaries will be helpful for you in making sure the five (5) executive summaries you choose to submit are of a high standard. The questions you need to respond to in your executive summaries relating to the case studies for each week are available in the Blackboard. It is recommended that you shall come to class prepared with notes, meet in groups of about four/five to critically analyse the case and respond to the burning question(s). Based on the group discussions, you then write up an Executive Summary as a group for that case outlining their analysis and proposing recommendations that are justified clearly using course concepts, ideas, and theories. 

At the end of each Executive Summary, you will be required to submit details of the contributions of each member of the group. Contributions will be used to adjust students' individual group assignment results.

Your facilitator will provide you with feedback on your submission each week so that you can make improvements where needed in your subsequent submissions. The best 5 marks out of 7 will contribute towards the final grade for each group. Each group will submit the Executive Summary both in Blackboard and Turnitin. Students will submit it during the seminar only.

In completing this assignment students will have demonstrated their ability to work collaboratively in a group, identify issues in the real-world context, make a professionally written submission, apply multi-disciplinary knowledge, and produce a well-reasoned and evidence-based argument.

A Note on Teamwork:  

• Although we hope all team members will work happily with each other and learn from each other, problems can occur. If so, please first deal with this issue immediately with your team member. To excel as business leaders, you will need to deal openly, constructively, and in a timely manner with any issues in your team.

• Consistent problematic issues regarding team member participation will prompt a meeting with the course-coordinator with the intent to reintegrate the erring member. Uncooperative members run the risk of having their grade reduced to account for their behavior’s assumed negative effect on their team’s project and as a deterrent to social loafing.

• It is strongly recommended that each team appoint a Secretary-Recorder (This can be a rotating or shared role), who will maintain a log of all team activities (including attendance at meetings and team member follow-through on commitments) for my review upon request in the event of problematic team members.

• You are encouraged to have a Leader to facilitate the teamwork. Again, this can be a rotating or shared role to give everyone the opportunity to lead.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

assessments.assessment_title: Report on Training Program and Evaluation
assessments.task_description:
Goal: The goal of this assessment is to design and develop a comprehensive training program. To conduct a training needs analysis resulting in a learning/development initiative, develop a training program including design, method and evaluation considerations.

Product: A Proposed Training Program with Evaluation Considerations.

Description: You are to develop a training program for an organization you have chosen (e.g., one where you are interested in applying for a job). You will need to ensure you have gathered appropriate information about the organization and the trainees to analyse their training and/or career development needs. Also, it is NOT necessary to contact the organisation for interviews or visits. Students should rely only on secondary research including but not limited to company websites, strategic plans, annual reports, industry and analysts' reports.

Report Requirements: Training Needs Assessment to determine the priority development needs of a particular group of employees within the organisation with consideration of program design, method and program evaluation. A recommended Training Program to address the priority development needs of a particular group of employees within the organisation.

A word limit of 1,500 words applies to the written text. Students are required to support their analysis with a minimum of 10 academic peer-reviewed sources.

NOTE: Text excludes title page, executive summary, table of contents, appendices, and references).

Additional details and assessment requirements and marking criteria will be provided in seminar and on blackboard.

Format Requirements: You are to complete the work in business report format, including: a title page; executive summary; table of content, tables and figures; an introduction; information about the organization, position and trainee; background issues/environmental scan; the analysis/needs assessment; and the concerns, conclusions and recommendations. You will need to consider/propose design and method implications.

1. Use APA 7 style in the reference section and when citing relevant literature that supports your decisions and procedures. With referencing key considerations are: (1) consistency of use; and (2) proper acknowledgement of quotes. NOTE: Additional guidance on proper citation can be found via the Library Write and Cite module: https://web.library.uq.edu.au/library-services/students/writing-citing-and-submitting-assignments  

2. At least 10 academic journal articles should be used appropriately.

3. The font will be 12 pt, Times New Roman, double spaced.

4. The page should be with 2.54 cm margins all around.

5. Appendices should be used as supporting material. Appendices must be: (1) referenced in the text, and (2) kept in order of their reference. Be careful that the point you make in the text by using an appendix is clear and that, in combination, the appendices are logically consistent. NOTE: Appendices are placed AFTER references in the report.

assessments.task_description:
Task Description:

The exam will take the form of MCQs and short essay questions. The exam will include all materials covered in the course from Weeks 5-12. This is not an open-book exam. You will need to answer the questions using information based on your weekly lectures, workshops, and readings. A good essay will not be based on your opinions only but also demonstrated in-depth knowledge and understanding of the MGTS3604 course theories/concepts and evidence using examples from the course case studies to support your arguments in answering questions. The questions may have multiple parts (e.g., A, B, C, D). You must answer all parts of each question to receive full marks. A good essay will be between 400-600 words for each whole question. You must use prose style with well-structured sentences and paragraphs. Dot points will be worth a fraction of the marks allocated. You do not need to provide references, but you will need to write using English academic language that is concise and clear for your marker to understand.

AI Statement

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
